cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who is the actor that plays ducky on ncis
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
To determine who plays the character Ducky on the television show NCIS, I need to recall the cast of the show. Ducky, whose full name is Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard, is a medical examiner and a prominent character in the series. I remember that Ducky is portrayed by a well-known actor who has had a long career in television and film. 

After considering the character and the show, I can conclude that the actor who plays Ducky is David McCallum. He has been part of the NCIS cast since the show began in 2003.

Answer: David McCallum

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who is the actor that plays ducky on ncis
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- On "NCIS" season 12 episode 3 (October 7th 2014), Ducky (played by David McCallum) mentioned he used to play this game with his best friend Angus as a child.\n', 'BULLET::::- Ducky Mallard, medical examiner in the TV series "NCIS", played by David McCallum\n', 'Since 2003 McCallum has starred in the CBS television series "NCIS" as Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard, the team\'s chief medical examiner and one of the show\'s most popular characters. In Season 2 Episode 13 "The Meat Puzzle", NCIS Special Agent Caitlin Todd (Sasha Alexander) asks Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs (Mark Harmon), "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?" and Gibbs replies, "Illya Kuryakin".\n', 'Since September 2003, McCallum has been playing Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard in the highly successful American TV series "NCIS". In the Season 2 episode "The Meat Puzzle", around 20:50 into the episode, when Special Agent Kate Todd asks Special Agent Jethro Gibbs "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?," Gibbs responds "Illya Kuryakin". In that same episode, a photo of a much younger Ducky is actually a promotional photo from McCallum\'s "Man from U.N.C.L.E." days. In an episode during the 12th season of NCIS Dr. Mallard revisits his younger life in England. While looking at a photo of his younger self he states, "I miss those turtle-necks." an apparent reference to the wardrobe of Kuryakin.\n', "BULLET::::- Tress MacNeille as Daisy Duck, Chip 'n' Dale\n", 'BULLET::::- Judith Barsi as Ducky\n', 'Beginning in 2003, McCallum starred in the CBS television series "NCIS" as Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard, M.D., a medical examiner. During the episode "The Meat Puzzle" (season\xa02, episode\xa013), as an inside joke, NCIS agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs (Mark Harmon) is asked, "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?" Gibbs responds, "Illya Kuryakin". The photo supposedly of a younger Ducky is actually a promotional photo from McCallum\'s "Man from U.N.C.L.E." days.\n', 'Ducky is a medical examiner assigned to NCIS Headquarters. cognition.content:
Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.

question_info.question: who is the actor that plays ducky on ncis
passages:
BULLET::::- On "NCIS" season 12 episode 3 (October 7th 2014), Ducky (played by David McCallum) mentioned he used to play this game with his best friend Angus as a child.
BULLET::::- Ducky Mallard, medical examiner in the TV series "NCIS", played by David McCallum
Since 2003 McCallum has starred in the CBS television series "NCIS" as Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard, the team's chief medical examiner and one of the show's most popular characters. In Season 2 Episode 13 "The Meat Puzzle", NCIS Special Agent Caitlin Todd (Sasha Alexander) asks Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs (Mark Harmon), "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?" and Gibbs replies, "Illya Kuryakin".
Since September 2003, McCallum has been playing Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard in the highly successful American TV series "NCIS". In the Season 2 episode "The Meat Puzzle", around 20:50 into the episode, when Special Agent Kate Todd asks Special Agent Jethro Gibbs "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?," Gibbs responds "Illya Kuryakin". In that same episode, a photo of a much younger Ducky is actually a promotional photo from McCallum's "Man from U.N.C.L.E." days. In an episode during the 12th season of NCIS Dr. Mallard revisits his younger life in England. While looking at a photo of his younger self he states, "I miss those turtle-necks." an apparent reference to the wardrobe of Kuryakin.
BULLET::::- Tress MacNeille as Daisy Duck, Chip 'n' Dale
BULLET::::- Judith Barsi as Ducky
Beginning in 2003, McCallum starred in the CBS television series "NCIS" as Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard, M.D., a medical examiner. During the episode "The Meat Puzzle" (season 2, episode 13), as an inside joke, NCIS agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs (Mark Harmon) is asked, "What did Ducky look like when he was younger?" Gibbs responds, "Illya Kuryakin". The photo supposedly of a younger Ducky is actually a promotional photo from McCallum's "Man from U.N.C.L.E." days.
Ducky is a medical examiner assigned to NCIS Headquarters. He is a crossover character from "NCIS".
BULLET::::- Donald "Ducky" Mallard, character in the TV show "NCIS"
BULLET::::- Tress MacNeille as Daisy Duck and Chip
